definition: front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks

sentences.english: Her weight is now on her front foot.
sentences.chinese: 她的重心现在在前脚上。

sentences.english: Tom taught his small dog to beg.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆教他的小狗举起前脚做乞求状。

sentences.english: He sits up on his back legs and puts his front paws together before the altar .
sentences.chinese: 牠会用后腿坐立在祭坛前，前脚合掌拜拜。

sentences.english: When your shoulders are rounded and you stand up, your weight falls to the front of your foot, " says Price.
sentences.chinese: 当你跑步的时候，你的体重就都落在了你的前脚掌上。

sentences.english: The lockdown straps located on the top of the forefoot and medial ankle regions secure the foot snugly.
sentences.chinese: 前脚顶部以及延伸至踝部的锁带紧紧地牢固住脚部。

sentences.english: The steps are counted as foreleg moves back.
sentences.chinese: 后退的步数是按照前脚往后移的次数计算。

sentences.english: You may turn your front foot outward very slightly if it is more comfortable.
sentences.chinese: 如果舒服的话，你可以把前脚轻轻地向外转。

sentences.english: Its gripping strength on the forefeet also recovered to up to 80 percent.
sentences.chinese: 前脚的抓握力量也恢复超过80%以上。

sentences.english: There are five claws on the forefeet and four on the rear.
sentences.chinese: 它们的前脚有五枚爪子，后脚则为四枚。

sentences.english: When your shoulders are rounded and you stand up, your weight falls to the front of your foot, " says Price."
sentences.chinese: 当你跑步的时候，你的体重就都落在了你的前脚掌上。

sentences.english: He ducked with his head and shoulders, scraped with more advanced hoof, bolted the alcohol.
sentences.chinese: 他脑袋和肩膀一缩，前脚一伸，把酒囫囵吞下肚。

sentences.english: They just set foot in the entrance, when a well-dressed man approached them.
sentences.chinese: 他们前脚走进入口，一个良好着装的男子迎面走来。

sentences.english: Oh – the front foot is rolling on to the outside edge.
sentences.chinese: 噢，前脚慢慢走到外缘来，这个动作是要有基础的。

sentences.english: The steps are counted as each foreleg moves back.
sentences.chinese: 后退的步数是按照前脚往后移的次数计算。

sentences.english: I got off and immediately tied one of his front legs up .
sentences.chinese: 我火大了，干脆直接立刻用绳子绑住它的一只前脚。

definition: to be just about to/to have just started to
at a stride/taking large steps (while walking)
who would have thought that/who would have expected that
not saying anything further (idiom); not raising any objection/without demur
who would have thought that/who would have expected that
(of a person) to turn round/to face about/(of a widow) to remarry (archaic)
